name: discriminability
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the ability to see, hear, or measure the difference between two things: discriminability of We tested the discriminability of the pairs of sounds. They categorized the words into four sets based on their acoustic discriminability.
More examplesFewer examplesThe study highlights the important role of discriminability between testing items. The study examined the discriminability of the different odours to bees. Patients showed good discriminability with respect to distinguishing between the drug and placebo phases of the trial. A scale was used to establish discriminability of the two treatments in the study.
